stream_items.title: Bitcoin Cash feud deepens as famous @Bitcoin Twitter account mysteriously disappears
stream_items.summary: Twitter’s suspension of the popular cryptocurrency news account @Bitcoin has fuelled speculation that it relates to a long-running feud in the bitcoin community. The anonymous owner of the @Bitcoin account is a proponent of Bitcoin Cash, a rival cryptocurrency to bitcoin that was established following disagreements about bitcoin could support the huge numbers of people who want to use it. Online speculation about why the account was temporarily suspended centres on the theory that supporters of the original cryptocurrency may have reported the account to Twitter for either posting spam or impersonating someone else.

stream_items.title: 'Go home to vote': Malaysian Twitter users, firms offer to pay travel costs
stream_items.summary: With a general election called for midweek on May 9, Malaysians took to social media on Tuesday to offer funding to help people return to their home towns to vote, while some companies offered employees days off. The election could prove to be the toughest test of the ruling coalition's 61-year grip on power, with embattled Prime Minister Najib Razak under pressure to deliver an emphatic win. Najib is struggling to appease Malaysians unhappy with rising costs and a multi-billion dollar scandal at a state fund he founded.

stream_items.title: Photos: Underwater fish’s-eye vortex
stream_items.summary:
These incredible underwater images are taken of gigantic bloom of sardines as they form the shape of a fish's eye. The massive school of fish appears like a gigantic swirling vortex as it parts ways to allow divers to swim through, before reforming in a silver shimmer. Incredibly, the otherworldly shot was also captured with a fish-eye lens by Jerome Kim, from Manila, Philippines. (Caters News)

stream_items.summary: The European Aviation Security Agency (EASA) has warned pilots and airlines to expect missiles in the sky as the US and allies consider air strikes into Syria.

stream_items.title: Photos: ‘The Last Three’: Behind the effort to save the northern white rhinoceros
stream_items.summary:
Artists Gillie and Marc Schattner have created the world’s tallest bronze rhino sculpture in Astor Place, New York City,  as a means to inspire and mobilize people to affect real change against rhino horn sales. Their art calls for humans to work together to make sure that history doesn’t repeat itself. The 17-foot-tall sculpture will be used to raise critical awareness and the funds needed to protect northern white rhinos.

stream_items.title: Man seen cutting down memorial to stabbed burglar
stream_items.summary: A man with a hat pulled low over his eyes suddenly appeared at the memorial to Henry Vincent and began to cutting down the flowers and other tributes. Armed with a pair of scissors the middle aged man who said he was a "local" branded the memorial to the stabbed burglar an "insult." He threw the flowers and tributes on the floor before he began stamping on them. After, he ran to another spot at the end of the road and cut further flowers loose.

stream_items.title: Moment 'furious' vigilante tears down shrine left for Henry Vincent, career criminal killed by pensioner
stream_items.summary: This is the moment a furious man destroys a shrine dedicated to a career criminal who was killed by a pensioner during a break-in.  Flowers and balloons were tied to a fence near to the home of Richard Osborn-Brooks, 78, in memory of Henry Vincent, a burglar who preyed on the elderly who died following a confrontation with the pensioner in south-east London last week.  The man detailed how he drove to the south London home, removed the tributes and left the flowers at a nearby graveyard.

stream_items.title: In pictures: World’s biggest cruise ship featuring golf course, casino and basketball court prepares for maiden voyage
stream_items.summary: The world’s biggest cruise ship – that features a full-sized basketball court and ice rink – is preparing to set sail on its maiden voyage. Also taking the title of the most expensive cruise ship in the world, Royal Caribbean’s ‘ Symphony of the Seas ’ also features a casino, miniature golf course and a zip-wire. Currently docked in Malaga, Spain, the vast ship will launch on 31 March and take its first paying passengers in April. MORE: Jobless footy fan who won £9m on Lotto reveals he broke up with his girlfriend five weeks ago MORE: Sailsbury poisoning: Police confirm the Skripals were poisoned with nerve agent on ex-spy’s front door Weighing a staggering 228,000 tonnes, the 1,188 feet long ship is only 20 metres shorter than the Empire State Building in New York. The £959m vessel was built at a shipyard in Saint Nazaire, France, and houses 20 restaurants and over six bars – including one with bartending robots. Symphony of the Seas will call at ports in Spain, France and Italy as it begins the summer season.

stream_items.title: Anti-abortion protests banned outside London clinic
stream_items.summary:
Campaigners are hopeful it is "just the beginning" after a council voted to introduce the first ban on protesters demonstrating outside an abortion clinic.

Ealing Council's cabinet voted unanimously in favour of allowing a Public Spaces Protection Order to create a protest-free safe zone outside a Marie Stopes clinic in the west London borough.
